action.action-desc: Mr. Jackson (for himself and Mr. Duncan) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Energy and Commerce

form.official-title: To eliminate taxpayer funding for the partisan radio outlet known as National Public Radio, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Partisan Radio Act or the NPR Act.

section.header: Prohibition on Federal funding for National Public Radio

subsection.text: After the date of the enactment of this Act, no Federal funds may, directly or indirectly, be made available to or used to support the organization described in subsection (b), including through the payment of dues to or the purchase of programming from such organization by a public broadcast station using Federal funds received by such station.
The organization described in this subsection isâ€”

paragraph.text: the organization known, as of the date of the enactment of this Act, as National Public Radio; or
any successor organization to the organization described in paragraph (1).
